title: 12g Extended Bloom
preparation_steps: Add coffee to V60 and tare scale

brewing_steps.instruction: Pour 40g water for bloom. Wait 2 minutes.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Start timer. Pour 40 grams for the bloom. Now, wait patiently for a full 2 minutes. Yes, 2 minutes. Wait until all bubbles stop rising. This long bloom helps prevent clogging later.
At 2 minutes, begin your first main pour. Spiral slowly up to 130 grams. Aim to finish this pour by 2 minutes 15 seconds.
Pour the remaining water to reach 200 grams total by 2 minutes 30 seconds. Then let it draw down.

what_to_expect.description: This recipe tackles the common stalling issue with Ethiopians and other dense beans. The ultra-long 2-minute bloom softens the coffee bed significantly, allowing for a coarser grind and faster flow later on.
what_to_expect.audio_script: If you've ever had a V60 stall or clog, this recipe is for you. By extending the bloom to a massive 2 minutes, we fully saturate and soften the grounds, ensuring a smooth flow even with finicky beans.

notes: This recipe specifically addresses the clogging problem by extending bloom time and using fewer fines.
